IncidentAddress.IncAddrComment: N SOLOMONS ISLAND RD/ TRASKERS BLVD

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: This incident was audibly and visually recorded using the Axon Digital Video Camera System installed in Maryland State Police Unit, U-32, as well as my Axon body worn camera. Defendant: Michael Dewayne Burke Jr. Date of Birth: 01/06/2004 Date of Arrest: 10/07/2023 DUI #21-0088 Certificate and Training: I am trained in the administration of Standardized Field Sobriety Tests. That training was received at the Maryland State Police Academy in 2023. Narrative: On October 7, 2023, at approximately 2339 hours, I Trooper Sklar #7675, responded to a traffic complaint for a suspected impaired driver. The complainant, later identified as, Joel Blaine Collins, (D.O.B. 04/25/1980), advised the Calvert County Control Center that driver was driving a red Chevrolet Silverado bearing Maryland registration, 4FB5372. Collins advised he witnessed the driver strike a guardrail and drive on the wrong side of the road in Hughesville, Charles County, Maryland and continued to operate the vehicle recklessly. Collins advised the driver stepped out of the vehicle and approached him. Collins advised, he was able to smell the strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from the driver. At approximately 2340 hours, I was at Church Street and Maryland Route 4 waiting for a green light. When the light turned from red to green, I observed the vehicle make a left turn onto northbound Maryland Route 4 from Hallowing Point Road in Prince Frederick, Maryland. While entering the intersection, I observed the red Chevrolet continue through a steady red light. I made a right turn onto Maryland Route 4 and activated my emergency equipment in an attempt to initiate a traffic stop. I was approximately 450 feet behind the Chevrolet in lane 2. The vehicle maintained a constant speed at a high rate passing Main Street and Dares Beach Road. I was unable to close the distance between my vehicle and the Chevrolet due to the vehicles speed. I observed the Chevrolet change lanes from lane 2 to the right turn lane at Traskers Blvd and strike a curb with both passenger side wheels. I also observed the Chevrolet pop up in the air after striking the curb. The Chevrolet then came to a stop in the right turn lane at Traskers Blvd. Both passenger side wheels were disabled on the Chevrolet. I made a driver side approach to the vehicle and instructed the driver to exit the vehicle. I could smell the strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from the vehicle. The driver exited the vehicle, and I observed that his eyes were bloodshot and glassy and I detected the strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from his breath and person. The driver had slurred speech. The driver was identified as, Michael Dewayne Burke Jr, W/M (D.O.B. 01/06/2004), by his Maryland drivers license. Due to the circumstances of the incident, I placed Burke in my custody and informed him he was under arrest. I asked Burke if he would submit to voluntary Field Sobriety Tests, Burke advised he would not. After initially refusing, Burke advised he would take the Standardized field sobriety tests. I asked Burke if he had any medical issues or conditions that would impact his ability to complete the testing. I asked if he took any medications. I asked if he wore glasses or contacts. Burke stated that he had Crohns Disease and that he took melatonin for medication. Burke responded no to all other questions. Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus: Total Clues 2 of 6 (Unable to complete) The first test administered was the Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus Test. The tip of a pen was used as the tests stimulus and was held approximately 12 inches away from Burkes eyes. Burke was instructed to look straight ahead, keeping his head still while following and focusing on the tip of the pen with his eyes until told to stop. Burkes pupil size were equal. Burke presented equal tracking in both eyes. margin-left:8px">Burke Displayed lack of smooth pursuit in both eyes Following the first pass of the Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus test, Burke was beginning to fall forward into me. Burke advised he would no longer take the Standardized field sobriety test. Walk and Turn: (Not Completed) Burke advised he would not complete the tests. One Leg Stand: (Not Completed) Burke advised he would not complete the tests. Arrest: Based on the following, I had the reason to believe Burke was operating a motor vehicle under the influence of alcohol. Burke was reported by Collins to have struck a guardrail and drive on the wrong side of the road. I Observed Burke driving erratically and strike the curb with his vehicle. Burke stated he had been drinking. I observed Burke had bloodshot and glassy eyes. I detected the strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from the vehicle and his person. At approximately 2342 hours, I placed Burke under arrest for driving under the influence of alcohol. I placed Burke in my patrol vehicle and played the DR-15 Advise of Rights audio in English. At the conclusion of the DR-15 Advise of Rights audio, I asked Burke if he would submit to the Intoximeter test. Burke advised that he would take the test on October 8, 2023 at approximately 0008 hours. I transported Burke to the Maryland State Police Prince Frederick Barrack. While at the barrack, the intoximeter test was conducted by Cpl. Oleksak #6300 of the Maryland State Police, on a certified instrument (Serial # 011768) at 0050 hours. Burke had a result of .21 grams of alcohol per 210 liters of breath. I transported Burke to Calvert County Detention Center for processing. Burke was issued numerous DUI related citations. Case closed by arrest. All events occurred in Calvert County, Maryland.
